alert.note: Alert for Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 8:14AM CDT until July 09 at 8:27PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River at Oklahoma City at Britton Road affecting Oklahoma County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Canadian River at Oklahoma City at Britton Road. * WHEN...From this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Low-lying croplands and pastures east of Oklahoma City near the towns of Spencer and Jones are briefly flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 17.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM CDT.
